title: U.S. Seals Security Pact With Japan and South Korea as Threats Loom
description: While the former president’s name appeared nowhere in the communique issued by three leaders, one of the subtexts was the possibility that he could return to power in next year’s election and disrupt ties with America’s two closest allies in the Indo-Pacific region.

title: Judge Throws Out Accused Bomber’s Confession as Derived from Torture
description: The Saudi defendant was waterboarded and subjected to other forms of torture by the C.I.A. in 2002 in a secret prison network.

title: Junta Official in Niger Claims Captive President Will Not Be Harmed
description: In an interview with The New York Times, a civilian leader of the junta sounded a conciliatory tone. He also said Niger would not summon the Kremlin-backed Wager Group.

title: Canada Wildfires Force Evacuations in Yellowknife and Kelowna
description: As residents of Yellowknife fled a wildfire in the Northwest Territories, a state of emergency was issued hundreds of miles away in Kelowna, British Columbia.

title: Guatemala’s Anti Corruption Crusader is on Cusp of Presidency
description: Can an intellectual on an anti-graft crusade win the presidency in a nation sliding toward authoritarianism? Guatemala is about to find out.

title: Biden Welcomes Japanese and South Korean Leaders to Camp David Summit
description: President Biden is hosting the leaders of the two Asian nations to overcome historical grievances and present a united front in the face of an increasingly assertive China.

title: Ukraine War Casualties Near Half a Million, U.S. Officials Say
description: Ukraine and Russia have lost a staggering number of troops as Kyiv’s counteroffensive drags on. A lack of medical care has added to the toll.

title: Tenerife Wildfire Forces Thousands to Evacuate
description: The blaze on Tenerife has burned almost 10,000 acres and forced thousands of residents in the north to lock down or flee.

title: Intelligence Agencies Warn Foreign Spies Are Targeting U.S. Space Companies
description: U.S. officials say Chinese and Russian spy agencies are trying to steal technology from private American space companies and preparing cyberattacks that could disable satellites in a conflict.

title: What Is That Question Mark in Space? Here’s What We Know — and Don’t Know
description: Close scrutiny of a recent image from the Webb Space Telescope revealed some questionable punctuation.

title: British Nurse, Lucy Letby, Convicted of Killing Seven Newborns
description: The nurse, Lucy Letby, was also found guilty of the attempted murders of six babies, ending a yearslong case that has haunted England.

title: Russia-Ukraine War: Russia Accuses Ukraine of Drone Attacks Targeting Moscow, Black Sea Fleet
description: Russia’s defense ministry claimed that its air defenses intercepted a drone in Moscow and that it thwarted a maritime drone attack in the Black Sea. The claims could not be independently verified and there was no comment from Ukraine’s military.

title: Maui’s Emergency Management Chief Resigns After Questions About Hawaii Fire Response
description: The chief, Herman Andaya, cited his health in stepping down. His agency’s decision not to sound emergency sirens as wildfires neared Lahaina had drawn scrutiny.

title: Mohamed Bazoum, Niger President Ousted in Coup, Remains Imprisoned at Home
description: President Mohamed Bazoum had grown alarmed at military takeovers sweeping across Niger’s neighbors. Then his own soldiers came for him. Weeks later, he remains imprisoned in his home.

title: Belief or Betrayal? Ukraine’s Conscientious Objectors Face Hostility
description: The option of “alternative service” vanished after martial law was declared last year. But some have refused to serve, and now face jail time and skepticism about their motives.

title: To Stop an Extinction, He’s Flying High, Followed by His Beloved Birds
description: Using an ultralight aircraft, Johannes Fritz once taught endangered ibises a migration path over the Alps. Because of climate change, he is now showing them a much longer route to a winter’s refuge.

title: Up the Matildas!
description: Australia’s national women’s soccer team have walked away with the nation’s hearts clasped firmly in their hands.

title: Private Jet Crashes Into Malaysia Highway, Killing 10
description: The plane crashed on the outskirts of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia’s capital and largest city, killing all eight people on board and two people on the ground.

title: Friday Briefing
description: A deadly boat accident off Cape Verde.

title: In China, More Single Female Home Buyers, Resisting Sexist Norms
description: The housing market in China is in turmoil. But more and more women, facing a less equal society, are buying their own homes in search of security.

title: Allies to Be Allowed to Send F-16s to Ukraine, U.S. Official Says
description: The jets can be sent once Ukrainian pilots are trained to operate them.
